intro: Schizoglossum tricuspidatum, commonly known as the three-lobed spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Schizoglossum. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Schizoglossum tricuspidatum is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots and drought-tolerant characteristics.
